page.title: 03COMBROOK CONTINUED.
page.content: Combrook is one of only two settlements in the "D Block" and the only one which lies entirely within it.It has a population of approximately 150 housed in the attractive terraced or detached cottages of Eastwold limestone,under thatched or slated roofs,or one of the modern bungalows or houses.Some villagers inevitably still rely upon the land for their livelihood,but the number is steadily diminishing.A short journey of some two miles takes some residents to Kineton,where shops, offices,and small industrial units provide some work.Wellesbourne a rapidly expanding village some four miles away provides similar employment.Combrook is a village which attracts people wishing to live in an attractive rural community,but going by car to work elsewhere.
